body:
Have been trying to create a buildcache for portable environment and the whole buildcache functionality doesn't work as documented.

Started trying to package out boost with `spack buildcache create boost`
This fails with an error:
```==> Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '<$SPACK_ROOT>/opt/spack/linux-sles12-x86_64/gcc-7.2.0/boost-1.63.0-lepwxyngcwiivbis2gvggxngkjhsjhd2'```

The error is correct as the directory `boost-1.63.0-lepwxyngcwiivbis2gvggxngkjhsjhd2` doesn't exist. Boost is installed at `boost-1.63.0-3l45zb24jjzwivmhnkgbgndoucpxohug` with a different hash.

Uninstalling and re-installing boost generates a version of boost with the expected hash. So First issue is that buildcache doesn't automatically detect installed versions based of installed hashes, it generates a hash assuming the hashes will always be the same. This is consistently an issue with every package I have installed locally, and if possible I wish to avoid recompiling everything to get the expected hashes.

Once I got the boost package installed in the buildcache, I attempted to install from it into a new location.  Adding the mirror worked, and I was able to see the contents of the buildcache with `spack buildcache list` things looked good until I ran into issues installing boost

It appears that when the build caches are generated the full set of files needed for installing them isn't created.
title: Spack buildcaches don't function as documented
